website_summaries.verdict: A nutritious and tasty food source for guinea pigs that most can't resist. Excellent addition to a well-rounded diet that also includes pellets and fresh greens.
pros: All natural Timothy hay that doesn't contain any artificial additives
Low protein and high fiber promote urinary tract and digestive health
Customers rave about the fresh, pleasant aroma
cons: Quality can be inconsistent, as some bags contained a lot of small, hard stem pieces while others consisted of more leafy hay

customer_reviews.title: 50% Dust
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother, this is not the hay your looking for. I've bought Kaytee Hay in the pet store a number of times and its decent, not stellar or anything but its okay. I much prefer to buy from the house rabbit society, but we don't have one near my new home. The Katee hay being sold here on Amazon is not the same quality I was getting in the pet store.This hay is being produced in Canada, and its just awful. Most of it is unusable dust and what's left is small pieces. My rabbits will eat some of it but most of it ends up getting thrown out.
customer_reviews.author: David680

customer_reviews.title: no good, get Oxbow instead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my two guinea pigs, unfortunately not reading the reviews, as I've had good luck with other Kaytee products like food and snacks. However, I would estimate that this is about 30-40% hay and the rest inedible sticks/straw. Reading reviews one day, I found, and have been a loyal buyer ever since. While there are still a few tough, inedible pieces in it (nothing's perfect, after all), the pigs eat the vast majority of it, and seem to really enjoy it. Trust me, you'll be much better off with Oxbow than this Kaytee garbage.
customer_reviews.author: MattDMo

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality...
customer_reviews.text: Hay was terrible product. Not sure why... We always get this size bag of Timothy Hay by Kaytee and it's devoured by the guinea pigs. Only difference is we bought this bag from Amazon. The packaging is identical to past bags, but the quality from Amazon distribution must be old or cheaper product from Kaytee. It was much more straw than hay. This package is getting tossed. Not only a waste of money, but also the pigs have been starving & I hadn't understood why, until now; they have new aggressive behaviors we have to address since starting this bag of food. It was the only change to their environment. Major bummer & frustration for pets & owner.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Long Healthy Quality Green Grass!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product from amazon because I was afraid to go to pet smart during shelter in place. I’m so glad I found this product on amazon because I ended up paying a lower price per pound of grass, which was also healthy green and long. The grass I buy for my rabbit at pet smart is short crumbled and yellow and dead. The grass I received in this product was green, thick and the strands of grass were long and healthy. My rabbit has been happily eating this grass. I also like how there’s a lot of grass in one package since it doesn’t run out so fast.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Very dry, dusty, and stale - One piggie has died
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this latest order was very, very poor quality. It's extremely dry (dehydrated) with very long pieces and not proper cut for guinea pigs. A couple of days after feeding this batch, one of the piggies developed breathing issues. We took her to the exotic vet, but they weren't able to save her. They said likely from this grass. My other one will NOT eat it at all. It's a very bad batch and something is wrong. This is not fresh, not cut, very dry, and seems more meant for a larger animal, not a guinea pig. :'o(
customer_reviews.author: JillyintheAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, Hay was brown
customer_reviews.text: Purchased prior wasn't a problem but not this time. Very disappointed, Hay was brown, dry, thick and hard appropriate for a horse, not a bunny. Now i question if it is worth purchasing hay or other perishables for that matter on-line without seeing the products state of freshness. Don't appreciate having to throw money away on a gamble. Signed Undecided.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OR COCKROACHES AND CRICKETS!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I have been buying this brand for the past year now and I discovered several bugs in the hay including cockroaches and crickets. It's disgusting, but Kaytee hay is cheaper than other high quality hay brands out there. I would suggest cutting the long stems into shorter pieces. My Guiana pig doesn't like it so long so i have to manually cut it myself. It's good quality green hay and I purchase this a lot at petco until I saw this on amazon. It's a good price here as compared to stores.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Large bag of hay dust mixed with small pieces of hay
customer_reviews.text: I really want to say good things about this product but I can't find a single thing. Have you ever gotten popcorn at the movies, once you start to eat it you realize you got day old bottom of the kettle rejects? That's exactly what I got. Hay from the bottom of the barrel. Small broken pieces of hay covered with lots of what I call hay dust. I have to shift through the hay, shake off the handful of dust 3 to 4 times before I get enough to feed my rabbit. I would say the bag is 1/2 hay pieces 1/2 hay dust (filler). It's awful. I will never again buy from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, but 1/4 of every bag is “dust”
customer_reviews.text: Kaytee is exactly what you expect for cheap hay. It’s not the worst, but it’s prickly and often stale. My biggest complaint is that the last 1/4 of every bag is inevitably messy “dust” that gets everywhere and clumps into these nasty cakes of horror when your animals urinate on it. When you figure the last 1/8 to 1/4 of your bag is worthless, you end up paying more per bag than it looks like. Best reserved to “in a pinch” situations. A little bit extra per pound gets you an entire usable bag of softer, nicer hay.
customer_reviews.author: Miss MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for Guinea Pigs
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 guinea pigs. One is very picky about what hay he eats. The other is not as picky. I see other people review their pigs eat the entire stalk, bud and stem, but neither of mine seem to have ever really eaten much of the stems. They eat some but really focus on the buds. Seems the same with other brands so I stick with this one because the price is great. Can't ask for a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonProShopper

customer_reviews.title: The only Hay my Bunnies like
customer_reviews.text: I had many bunnies in my lifetime but i never came across bunnies this picky until now. This is the only hay the like and will chomp down on from morning until evening. Forget more expensive brands or different flavors.
customer_reviews.author: germangirl88

customer_reviews.title: I got mites from this hay!!!
customer_reviews.text: mites live in the hay, and my right hand got covered in mite bites that were so itchy and nothing worked to kill them except the prescription for permethrin cream that I got from the doctor. It was horrible! I couldn't sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Stansell

customer_reviews.title: Been using it forever.
customer_reviews.text: Astounding price for astounglynlarge amount of hay. I have been using this brand forever with my rabbits and they all love it. It always arrives quite fresh from Amazon. I would suggest ifnyounonlynhave one rabbit like me and not a farm :) to get an airtight container to store this in so it doesn't go stale. You could keep the bag tied shut but I find it much easier to reach into a container.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: Our piggies say Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 female piggies love this hay. I read all the reviews and decided to go for this since I don't have the budget for raising piggies accustomed to fine dining hay and this stuff is great. They dive right in, munch away, fall asleep next to it. I don't expect much else. I also read about dust but don't find that to he an issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nechama

customer_reviews.title: 1st cutting, guinea pigs would not eat it
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs would not eat this. They would chew the grain off the tips, and spread this all over their cage as bedding. After some research, I found that this Kaytee Timothy Hay is a 1st cutting. I ordered second cutting Timothy Hay from another vendor and the guinea pigs LOVE it. I will never use this hay again, unless of course, we run out of bedding. Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Twelve Drummers Drumming

customer_reviews.title: Fast and total resolution of previous problem.  Will order again with confidence.
customer_reviews.text: First bag ordered was fine. Second and third order both contained more inedible straw than hay. I have taken pictures and am in the process of sending those to KayTee. Kaytee contacted me before I had a chance to contact them. After determining from the Use By Date that this batch was the problem, they refunded my money and told me if I ordered again in the future, I would find it had returned to they quality I expected. Sure enough, next bag was a different Use By Date and great quality. I will now order again with confidence. Anyone and any company can experience a problem. This company knows how to treat customers right and fix their problems..
customer_reviews.author: John J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Know what "cut" to buy for your animal!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a guinea pig. Perhaps I should have known more about the various "cuts" of hay. This bag contains a larger 1st cut style than I normally find in the Timothy Hay I generally buy. My guinea pig won't eat this larger, firmer, hay and so I've wasted my money but learned a lesson. Don't follow the pictures on the bag, as this is not a general purpose hay, especially when dealing with guinea pigs!
customer_reviews.author: Craig A

customer_reviews.title: So much fine grass dust....
customer_reviews.text: Product has so much grass dust, at least 25 percent of the bag.. I just don't understand this is a lot of waist besides making a mess..this was second purchase but I won't be buying this again it a shame quality want done so much I use to buy this all the time...
customer_reviews.author: Big V

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price!
customer_reviews.text: Our guinea pig loves this Timothy Hay. We have been purchasing this brand for a couple of years now and it is consistently fresh and the stalks are mostly intact. The product came in two bags placed in a sturdy box for shipping. Price was great and getting it shipped to our door was a great plus! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine for the price. I got a large amount for a decent price, and the hay was fine at first. However, I’m confused as to what cut this is. Some of the pieces are nice and soft, while others are hard and yellow, like straw. My pigs leave those ugly and bland pieces alone. I didn’t notice any of these pieces at first, only just now that I’m 3/4 way down the bag. I have also found weird pieces of sticks and roots. Considering I can get better quality hay for a similar price at KMS hayloft, I won’t be reordering.
customer_reviews.author: eva chiocchetti

customer_reviews.title: Great price, good product
customer_reviews.text: Best deal I have found for my angora bunny. I have ordered the large quantity, direct from grower hay, but postage makes that expensive and it is not fresh by the bottom of the box. This 6 pound Kaytee package is very good. Less than $2 a pound, postage free, fresh smelling, and apparently fresh tasting given how the bunny gobbles it. I wish it were not cut so small, but it is no worse than the bottom half of any expensive, large quantity box I have bought. As long as Amazon offers a good price with prime delivery, this will be my bunny's hay.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn D. Mack

customer_reviews.title: This hay smells like fish!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this brand of hay for my bunnies in the store with no problem but this stuff stinks like fish. It literally smells fishy. Hay should smell sweet and fresh. I can’t even fathom how they got it to smell like fish. Maybe I can still use it for bedding, but my bunnies aren’t eating this crap, and no wonder.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Hard, less leafy hay
customer_reviews.text: On flavor I had to go with my bunny’s opinion. It has a good hay-y smell - so I guess it is fresh. But the hay is very dry and hard and my bunny is not dying to eat it. It is a disappointment because smaller, store-bought packages of the same brand are much aofter and leafy and my bunny deigns to eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Bookaholic

customer_reviews.title: ZUZU loves it!
customer_reviews.text: They ask you to rate flavor & freshness... Ummm... I am not going to personally attest to those. Zuzu loves it so it is fresh enough for him. He likes this one more than most. He loves the generous amount of flower heads. He eats those first. Keep the flower heads coming!
customer_reviews.author: Lissette

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pig hates it
customer_reviews.text: Normally I purchase a different brand of organic meadow hay but my son’s guinea pig ges through it fast and this is the only brand I could find that has large enough bags of hay to last a full month. Big mistake. The poor little guy hates it. If you have a guinea pig, don’t purchase this particular hay.
customer_reviews.author: Rougue

customer_reviews.title: Mid priced, quality,  Timothy hay
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how much 12lbs of hay was going to be or how long it would last but I needed a mid priced, quality, Timothy hay and that's what I got. They shipped me two 6lb bags, which made it easier to store and kept it fresher longer. I'm set up to recieve 12lbs every 2mos seems about right for my very messy dwarf bun. He certainly likes it but requires new hay every day. He doesn't like leftovers.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bozarth

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The hay is packed well, and was delivered quickly. The bags appear to be vacuum sealed, and the timothy hay inside appears green and fresh. My rabbit loves it...she gets very excited in the morning when I give her the hay! I have found that once I open the bag, it stays fresher if I twist it back and seal it and then store the bag in a rubbermaid tote. I will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: J Winchel

customer_reviews.title: Old looking grass
customer_reviews.text: This was probably some of the worst grass i have got on Amazon. The brand i had been buying for a bit was not in stock so i took my chances with this. For my money i got a good amount but the quality is terrible. It's like it was put through a wood chipper and none of it seems fresh. Mostly brown and a sickly green.
customer_reviews.author: TopReport

customer_reviews.title: All Crumbly and in Tiny Shreds!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know how this can even be called hay! The whole pack is just full of crumbly shreds, like the remains when my previous packs of Timothy Hay is used up. I ordered this only because it was another family member that is in charge of ordering Timothy Hay for our guinea pigs and this time, he was away so I had to make the order. I guess I will have to just throw it into my compost bin.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Happy piggies
customer_reviews.text: My piggies like it, however if you have severe allergies it's best to let someone else touch it. I was finding I would give some to our piggies and end up with swollen eyes, sneezes and occasionally hives. I sneeze a bit more now than I use to but I no longer touch the hay and its mostly ok.
customer_reviews.author: Header

customer_reviews.title: Customer for Two Years
customer_reviews.text: I might as well become a monthly subscriber. The price for two of these bags costs less on Amazon than two bags at the nearest pet store to my location. My sulcata tortoise, Meatloaf, loves eating this Timothy hay mixed with grass, Mazuri, vitamins and other mixed greens. Meatloaf will be three years old in December. He probably goes through two bags once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Eloradanan

customer_reviews.title: Great Hay - Our Rabbits LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: We used to purchase this hay in smaller bags from PetSmart. This larger size bag lasts for several months and the consistency of the hay is great! The pieces of hay aren't too large to make too much of a mess and some is chopped up a bit here and there. Our rabbits love this hay and get this hay daily! One is more on the fussy side than the other but he still enjoys chowing down on this hay! No issues with any mold or bug problems and the bag is shipped safely and securely in a box to prevent bag tears. Will be buying again soon!
customer_reviews.author: ShakikiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: all of the leaves are all broken down to nearly powder
customer_reviews.text: I know Timothy hay is really good for my guinea pigs. They just finished the first one , but in the second bag, i did find all of the leaves are all broken down to nearly powder. When i just grab some hays for my guinea pigs , lot of " hay powder " will fall down on their body. It makes them dirty. And many rough stem inside.Our guinea pigs hate eating very rough stem. @@
customer_reviews.author: oncidium Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Small powdery hays and yellow/trash hay
customer_reviews.text: My two Rabbits don’t eat this as much as the other brands. After switching to this I noticed my rabbits eat more pallets. So many small hays and some yellow and trash stuff in it. I don’t know how to return it since I don’t have a big box to fit it in.
customer_reviews.author: Goli

customer_reviews.title: more dust than hay.
customer_reviews.text: I have become very unhappy with this produce, because there is so much like hay residue. Like dust, that the guineas don't eat . It always ends up on the floor of their cage , under the bedding. I'd rater have a real bale of hay from a farm, no waste.
customer_reviews.author: chinagirl

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend the 12lbs
customer_reviews.text: These are way better than the other one i got from Kaytee. This pack was way more fresh and it included more of the nutritious part. The other one I received (smaller pack) had a lot of tiny particles and dust, probably from a bad batch or something, but this one was definitely amazing. Perfect and fresh with tons of nutritious tops.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hong

customer_reviews.title: Decent Hay, Not the Best
customer_reviews.text: Overall, my guinea pigs do eat the hay and seem to enjoy it. They usually pick out the stiffer pieces of hay and leave them on the floor of their cage to pee on and sleep on. They love the oats, but I wish the hay was softer. Like I said, they won’t touch some of the pieces. I didn’t have any problems with finding rocks or any other objects in the hay, but there definitely was a lot of dust in the bag. It does work fine for piggies though.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Small broken hay
customer_reviews.text: This was a big bag which is great, but comes with a lot of small broken peices which are messy and my guinea pig didn't like to eat them. I feel like there's a lot of waste in the bag. I would have preferred mostly or all full sized hay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Customer
customer_reviews.text: Once we found this product, it is the only one we use. Personally I can not say much about the flavor because I am not willing to try it, but it is popular. It is a great value for the money and a must have at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: makes bunny sneeze:(
customer_reviews.text: Had been using standlee Timothy grass which our bunny loves but ordered this brand bc of availability and it made my bunny sneeze uncontrollably. We took out all this hay and replaced with the old brand and sneezing stopped.
customer_reviews.author: nix

customer_reviews.title: The is the new place where I buy hay!
customer_reviews.text: Far better quality hay than I used to buy at a certain large chain store nearby. And it's only two cents more per bag! I would buy the same brand at the store but for some reason it is just better from whatever Amazon gets it from! Plus, I'm not tempted to go to the store and buy a bunch of other things that I don't need when I only went in there to get hay!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Quality has taken a nose-dive recently
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this hay for my rabbits for over 2 years now. It's always been good, fresh timothy hay - no complaints. HOWEVER, the last couple of bags I've purchased have been less than desirable. The WHOLE bag is full of short, fine pieces of hay and hay dust. It's like they stuffed bags full of the loose shaken bits of hay that are typically found at the bottom of a good bag.. Purchasing another couple bags now, but I'm REALLY hoping to receive good quality, or else I will be returning and moving on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa and Hailee B

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and freshness
customer_reviews.text: I have a rabbit and this is definitely the hay of his choice. I’ve tried different brands thinking hay is hay, but hey, not all hay is good quality. Shipping if fast and packaging is good to ensure freshness.
customer_reviews.author: VF

customer_reviews.title: Short pieces of hay
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I bought Timothy hay online. It seemed like a good dea. However, I didn’t realize how much of this hay would be wasted. The pieces of hay are much shorter than the kind that we buy from the store (also Kaytee brand, I believe) so they fall through the bars of our dispenser. For some reason the guinea pigs don’t seem to eat the hay that falls on the floor of their cage so there is a lot of waste and mess.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer44

customer_reviews.title: Good, but online ordering can be hard with a picky bunny.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard product to get without seeing the quality of the hay inside. Our bunny is pretty picky and we always get Kaytee Timothy Hay, but she only really likes the soft upper parts of the plant not the thick stalks. So, we have ordered a few bags from Amazon and we have gotten some with the thick stalks and some that have the soft. So, for us it is hard to keep ordering without seeing the product when we are not getting what our bunny wants.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality! Bunnies love it!
customer_reviews.text: This product came exactly as described, good quality not a lot of powder either. Great for my bunnies, and 2 for a little over 20 is a steal given the cost for these bags for just 1 at the petstore.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Use to be good
customer_reviews.text: The quality has come down. This past two purchases (4 bags) came with dry, almost all brown, very little green, poor quality hay. My bunny is not happy. For the price, this quality is unacceptable. Its hard to return because I opened one bag and used some but the return has to be 2 bags together.
customer_reviews.author: LDS

customer_reviews.title: Good hay but felt like it had an abundance of sawdust hay crumbs.
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased as an add-on. It was a good price for the amount. The quality of the hay seemed a little "dusty". I felt like I bought the crumbs of the haystack. Maybe the bag described this and I didn't notice. I thought the pictures looked good though. I would get it again if I needed a lot of hay for a low price but the dust alone kind of made my allergies go off. It was literally like sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered these through subscribe & save & w/ each bag it’s quality got worse. Last 2 bags were 90% shredded grass. I had to throw most away so was prevent my guinea pigs from inhaling powdered hay.
customer_reviews.author: V.D.B.

customer_reviews.title: the first box is great, but second box is not as good as before.
customer_reviews.text: My first trial is great, fresh, smells really good. But my second trial is not that good, the hey become harder, and do not have that kind of fresh grass smell. Ang my bunny doesn’t like it as before.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, but some hay is unusable
customer_reviews.text: My bunny likes this hay a lot. However, I usually have to throw out the hay at the bottom of the bag as it is mostly crumbs/dust. I probably lose about 2 servings worth of hay for my small bunny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basically it's just powder. Will never buy this brand ...
customer_reviews.text: Basically it's just powder. Will never buy this brand again. My rabbit likes it at least long enough to pull it out of a toilet paper roller. This stuff is in pieces smaller then my hand. Just dust.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: My bunnies eat it up
customer_reviews.text: My two holland lops eat this hay and seem to love it. I know there are other brands that do second and third cuts, but mine seem to like this so unless I can find it cheaper I'll stick with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: My piggie loves this hay! He always gets excited when I fill his hay container with it. Spends hours chewing away, then hydrating himself with water. Always comes in fresh, fresher than a lot of other hay brands. If maintained in a dry, cool place, it doesn’t dry out.
customer_reviews.author: jmac91

customer_reviews.title: Fine but spendy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive way to get hay. I ordered online as I was stuck at home ill, but I will stick to the local feed store in future. Price aside, it's good quality hay and my guineas loved it. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Katie Bear

customer_reviews.title: bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many times Timothy hay. This batch which is the premium was full of hard , ends and sticks. My rabbit and guinea pugs wouldn't eat hardly any of it. I ended up returning it. I hope their quality is not going down hill.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asi asi
customer_reviews.text: My bunny really loves this hay but I’d say between 25-75% is inedible. It’s like hay dust and he doesn’t eat it and it just gets blown everywhere. The rest is good and he loves it good amount of seed heads which he enjoys. (First pic is the dust second is the good edible stuff)
customer_reviews.author: chris Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: not the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheaper brand of Timothy hay. My rabbits played with it more than eating it. Other brands they eat much better. This isn't the right cut of hay for them. It more like a bedding than anything nutritional for them. it did arrive quickly and in good shape
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: Product quality poor
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Kaytee Timothy hay for our rabbit for the past 8 years. She and I have approved. This time however, there was about 80% junk. See picture, and very little actual hay. She won't eat this stuff. I wasn't going to send a review but I changed my mind when I opened the 2nd bag and it too had very little actual hay pieces
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: we are regular users of this product for our guineas. They love it ! It is fresh initially but has to be wrapped tightly to stay like this. I liked the original packaging when we first bought this item as i felt it was fresher and smelled fresh for a long time. I believe it was when it was delivered in a box versus the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pig rated 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Kaytee Timothy Hay is my go to hay, for my little fuzzies. My guinea pigs enjoy this brand of hay, with it's fresh, edible sized grass and hay :=> I have tried other brands, but I usually end up with hay too big for my guineas girls to eat. That tears up their mouths, and ends up being used for a costly layer of bedding - that they didn't need.
customer_reviews.author: Mie

customer_reviews.title: Better price than big stores
customer_reviews.text: We usually buy it at Walmart but if you can have enough storage space, buy it here. Its the same quality (which is good) but arrives to your doorstep and is more that the size at the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: slim pickings
customer_reviews.text: these bags seem to contain smaller hay pieces and lots of hay dust compared to Oxbow a brand will usually use. also not a lot of tops included. the guinea pigs are eating it however
customer_reviews.author: Philip Kantzler

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Hay for my Bunny and Guinea Pigs!
customer_reviews.text: This hay is always fresh when I receive it and open the bag. My animals love it and finish it so fast. There's still a problem of dust throughout but it's not as much as other brands. The Subscribe and Save is the best deal I've found even compared to Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Sir Yodels of Hamburg loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Mr Yodes is fond of his tim hay. Although, I don't think I'd order online again... a lot of the hay broke down in transit and make the equivalent of that sugary mess at the bottom of cereal bags.
customer_reviews.author: Myles B Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Price - Mostly Dust
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend this hay anymore. The last three bags have shown that the quality has gone downhill. There was more dust in the bags than hay. I used to buy this hay and Kaytee pellets but I had to switch because both have just stopped having high quality ingredients. This can cause serious health issues for guinea pigs especially because they are prone to respiratory infections. The price is good but is it worth it when you’re just paying for dust?
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Thought my guinea pigs wasteful, turns out this is garbage
customer_reviews.text: My pigs would toss half of their hay on the floor of their cage and not eat it, I thought they were just messy. Switched to another, cheaper, better quality, brand and they don't waste a single strand of hay. Every bag has about 2 inches of dust on the bottom, making it some of it inedible. Sometimes I've had bags that smell fermented or foul.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: Such a great deal. My guinea pigs haven’t complained yet lol. So happy that I actually got 2 bags for such a great low price. I couldn’t believe it was a legit deal for that price. Set up subscribe and save I was so happy
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome hay - but careful not to get bad one
customer_reviews.text: I love this hay, my guinea pigs go crazy over it. I do have to say though, the quality of the hay depends on the bag and your luck. Sometimes I get a really good bag, sometimes a not so good bag. If this is a big worry of yours, I would recommend you go to the pet store in person so you can pick and choose.. otherwise you are depending on your luck.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 3 Guinea Pigs
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best value that I can find for Timothy Hay. The 3 guinea pigs that we have love the flavor of it. The hay comes fresh and love the fact that it is wafer cut. Makes putting in the cage easier & cleaner. Being able to put this on a subscription plan makes things so much easier for our busy life.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pigs give it 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: While I am not a consumer of Timothy Hay personally, our two guinea pigs enjoy it immensely. They give this product an enthusiastic "paws-up".
customer_reviews.author: Wiccandolin

customer_reviews.title: My guinea pigs like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. I bought this same size bag at the store for twenty dollars. The hay seems good to me, my guinea pigs seem to like it. One thing I really like about this brand is it has lots of the tail pieces,which are their personal favorites. I'd recommend this brand if you're going to buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality hay
customer_reviews.text: Not enough big long peices of hay. Much of it was like a fine powder almost. Bunny loved the big peices but then there's nothing left but the very fine powder like hay after that. Will get another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Bunny approved
customer_reviews.text: My bunny loves this better than Oxbow's greener Orchard grass. It can be very "twiggy" but she seems to like that. Mixed consistency... goes from twiggy to leafy in each handful. My bunny has gone from happily eating this every day to spending days on food strike only eating leafy greens and pellets. /shrug
customer_reviews.author: Daved Daly

customer_reviews.title: Turning brown
customer_reviews.text: I shouldnt have gotten the 12lb bag even though it's a good deal. Almost half left and is turning all brown. I notice my bunny is not eating it. I still have another bag to open. It prob turned brown.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Not too fresh!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a love/hate with hay! Some bags come with a lot of old brown hay but some are slightly fresher. It’s definitely a deal but I think I’ll just go back to my local feed store.
customer_reviews.author: Steel Family

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for guinea pigs in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This is very hard and long strips of hay. We have three guinea pigs that are not very picky. They will not eat this stuff besides the top pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our piggies like it just fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm no judge of hay of any kind; but our guinea pigs clearly love this stuff. I'm awaiting our third purchase. The price usually seems to be the cheapest too.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Chappuis

customer_reviews.title: Enormous bag, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately don't have the best idea of how much hay 96 ounces is but... it's a lot. This was an excellent price for the amount. It took maybe a third of the bag to fill half of my hamster's 55 gallon; I was totally expecting to have to dump the entire thing in when I purchased it, so I am very happy with this result. I won't have to order for another few cage cleans.
customer_reviews.author: ChachiTonks

customer_reviews.title: Good quality first & second cut mix
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our Guineas and black tail praire dog. Buying in this package of two helps save a few bucks then local animal store. 80% of there food is Hay.
customer_reviews.author: MKD

customer_reviews.title: Two Bags of LOW Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked this hay, and my bunny has loved it. This time, I ordered two 96oz bags of it, and both are the worst quality I've ever seen from Kaytee by far. My bunny will barely eat it because it's so short and dusty. I wish I could contact Kaytee to ask for different hay, but with all these other negative reviews, it doesn't seem likely they'd do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t fresh
customer_reviews.text: This batch wasn’t fresh. It already was turning brown. My piggies used it as a place to go to the bathroom more than eating it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Kaytee hay but these last two bags i received the hay is very, very dry and the pieces are all the ones my guinea pigs don’t t like. I will try another brand before I buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Great size, but the smell was terrible!! I normally can store hay in my home, but not this time. I had to remove it within 20 minutes because it was making us sick. Even our guinea pigs took awhile to consider trying to eat it. I have never smelled hay this disgusting. It's going to have to go back. Even shipping was delayed with no explanation yet. Prime delivery was not honored.
customer_reviews.author: René

customer_reviews.title: Cut so small half of it is dust like and not even long strands like normal
customer_reviews.text: Cut so small half of it is dust like and not even long strands like normal. My piggy doesn't care for it cause it's hard for him to pullout and chew. Not sure if it was just bottom of the barrel type deal for this bag cause I have bought this brand in pet stores and it was much easier to feed and for him to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Gosling

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: The Timothy Hay is a great value and I was able to buy two 96 oz bags for less than what I paid at Walmart for two small bags. My daughter has two Guinea Pigs, which were going through a small bag in no time and I was constantly at the store. The hay is fresh and the Guinea Pigs love it! It has made life easier having it delivered and able to buy in bigger quantities, so I can avoid the hassle of running to the store every week.
customer_reviews.author: Gina W.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to pull hay from without a huge mess. They hay has a nice fresh smell and the guinea pigs love it. I bought this because it costs less to buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Kylaandres

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Lasts a good long time, and is great for the price. Our little Bunny loves it every day. Great buy for the price! Lasts us months!
customer_reviews.author: H Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Not nourishing and weeds in it
customer_reviews.text: I was only feeding our bunny this hay and he was very thin and malnourished. I switched to a bunny pellet feed and he is plump and happy now. This also has a lot of weeds in it.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey C

customer_reviews.title: Picky rabbit won’t eat it.
customer_reviews.text: Rabbit refuses to eat it. Apparently picky rabbits want “second cut” hay. This stuff is like plastic straws by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Brown and withered
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this in the past and it was fine, but the last bag we got was more than half brown and withered, very nasty hay. As much as I prefer Amazon's price over the pet store, we're going to have to buy it locally because our guinea pigs won't eat this crap.
customer_reviews.author: JewelryMom

customer_reviews.title: Must be good, the pigs are eating so much of this
customer_reviews.text: tried other brands and this is a winner, but we have to fil up the holders twice day now as they are eating so much of it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wall

customer_reviews.title: Great is you like to waste money on old hay
customer_reviews.text: Just received this order. Can’t use this hay, spent way too much on this unusable product, the hay is old and brown. Also this item is non refundable so buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: krissi

customer_reviews.title: Found dead mouse in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve shopped on Amazon for years and have never left a review until now. I reached in to find I found a dried up dead mouse in it. I usually buy Oxbow, but I bought this stuff as a cheaper alternative, and now I think I’m never buying it again. Finding a dead mouse in something I have been feeding my rabbit is a bit of a turn off. Now I understand accidents happen and mice love nesting in grass, but I do believe Kaytee should have better quality control than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes more is best
customer_reviews.text: I was buying the store brand product, my guinea pigs loved it. But all they had was a much smaller bag. I ended up paying more every couple of weeks for hay, they buying this big bag, which my pigs equally like. I'm saving money and a trip to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Isley-Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality as 3/4 goes straight to the trash
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this one cause of compelling price. But comparing to other brand I used before when almost nothing was left by my piggy this one is just a full bag of straws which go eventually to the trash. My guinea pig eats only flower heads and just small quantity of actual grass which she is lucky to find out like a real pig searching for truffles.
customer_reviews.author: AlexR

customer_reviews.title: The first delivery was good but not this one
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This is the second time I have ordered this product. The first delivery was good but not this one. As soon as I opened the bag I knew something was wrong. The majority of the hay is brown and wet. I worry about where this was kept and if it would be harmful to my bunnies. I have to throw it out since it doesn't fit the return policy. I will never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 6.5m

customer_reviews.title: 50% powder
customer_reviews.text: I purchase Kaytee Timothy Hay for my guinea pigs and usually get a great product. Not this shipment. I've been through 3 out of 4 bags so far and they have been about 50% powder. This batch must have been from the bottom of the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: Clean, fresh grass.
customer_reviews.text: My rabbits love it, and none of the bags we have purchased - 3 or 4 now - have had mites or anything alarming.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: The pieces of hay in these bags are all broken up. Way too small. My guinea pigs only eat the hay when it's in longer pieces so the majority of the bag goes to waste. Disappointed because I usually have no problem with Kaytee brand. UPDATE: bought this months later hoping it wasn’t the same and it was. STAY AWAY FROM THIS BRAND.
customer_reviews.author: Sadbrina

product_meta.title: Kaytee Timothy Hay
product_meta.description: Size:12 pounds| Style:Blended CutKaytee feeds more hay to small pets than anyone else. We pride ourselves on providing fresh, tasty, all-natural hay. Kaytee timothy hay is hand selected to ensure long fiber strands and a proper leaf to stem ratio to support your small pet’s digestive health. At Kaytee, we understand that taste matters. Our hay tastes better because it is naturally grown and harvested with care. Our hay is grown in fertile farmland graced with abundant sunlight and nourished by cool, rocky mountain water. Naturally grown without pesticides or GMO, our farmers only grow supreme grade hay. This means, high quality and superior nutrition for your small pet. At Kaytee, we are committed to harvesting the best nature has to offer. Satisfaction Guaranteed or your money back.
feature_bullets: High fiber hay supports digestive health
Lower protein and calcium supports urinary health
High quality 1st and 2nd cut Western Timothy Hay blend

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
